com.sdklite.promise

Class Promise<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sdklite.promise.Promise<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Thenable<V>

    public class Promise<V>
extends Object
implements Thenable<V>
    Represents the eventual completion (or failure) of an asynchronous operation, and its resulting value.
    Author:
    johnsonlee

    • Method Detail

      • all

        public static Promise<Object[]> all(Object... iterable)
        Returns a single Promise that resolves when all of the promises in the array argument have resolved or when the array argument contains no promises. It rejects with the reason of the first promise that rejects.
        Parameters:
        iterable - An array.
        Returns:
        • An already resolved Promise if the iterable passed is empty.
        • An asynchronously resolved Promise if the iterable passed contains no promises.
        • A pending Promise in all other cases. This returned promise is then resolved/rejected asynchronously (as soon as the stack is empty) when all the promises in the given iterable have resolved, or if any of the promises reject.

      • all

        public static <T> Promise<T[]> all(Class<T> type,
                                   Object... iterable)
        Returns a single Promise that resolves when all of the promises in the array argument have resolved or when the array argument contains no promises. It rejects with the reason of the first promise that rejects.
        Parameters:
        type - The the value component type of returned Promise.
        iterable - An array.
        Returns:
        • An already resolved Promise if the iterable passed is empty.
        • An asynchronously resolved Promise if the iterable passed contains no promises.
        • A pending Promise in all other cases. This returned promise is then resolved/rejected asynchronously (as soon as the stack is empty) when all the promises in the given iterable have resolved, or if any of the promises reject.

      • all

        public static Promise<Object[]> all(Iterable<?> iterable)
        Returns a single Promise that resolves when all of the promises in the iterable argument have resolved or when the iterable argument contains no promises. It rejects with the reason of the first promise that rejects.
        Parameters:
        iterable - An iterable object such as a Collection.
        Returns:
        • An already resolved Promise if the iterable passed is empty.
        • An asynchronously resolved Promise if the iterable passed contains no promises.
        • A pending Promise in all other cases. This returned promise is then resolved/rejected asynchronously (as soon as the stack is empty) when all the promises in the given iterable have resolved, or if any of the promises reject.

      • all

        public static <T> Promise<T[]> all(Class<T> type,
                                   Iterable<?> args)
        Returns a single Promise that resolves when all of the promises in the iterable argument have resolved or when the iterable argument contains no promises. It rejects with the reason of the first promise that rejects.
        Parameters:
        type - The the value component type of returned Promise.
        args - An iterable object such as an Array or Collection.
        Returns:
        • An already resolved Promise if the iterable passed is empty.
        • An asynchronously resolved Promise if the iterable passed contains no promises.
        • A pending Promise in all other cases. This returned promise is then resolved/rejected asynchronously (as soon as the stack is empty) when all the promises in the given iterable have resolved, or if any of the promises reject.

      • resolve

        public static <T> Promise<T> resolve()
        Returns a Promise object that is resolved with null value
        Returns:
        a Promise that is resolved with null value

        public static <T> Promise<T> resolve(T value)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • resolve

        public static <T> Promise<T> resolve(Thenable<T> thenable)
        Returns a Promise instance with the specified thenable
        Parameters:
        thenable - The thenable to resolve
        Returns:
        a Promise will "follow" the thenable, adopting its eventual state.

      • reject

        public static <T> Promise<T> reject(Throwable reason)
        Returns a Promise object that is rejected with the given reason.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason why this Promise rejected.
        Returns:
        a Promise that is rejected with the given reason.
